item.title: AQUAPAZZA: Aquaplus Dream Match coming to PC in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/aquapazza-aquaplus-dream-match-coming-to-pc-in-2025

  • PC

Previously released for arcade and PlayStation 3.

Publishers DMM Games and Shiravune, and developer Aquaplus will release 2D fighting game AQUAPAZZA: Aquaplus Dream Match for PC via Steam in 2025, the companies announced. It will support English, Japanese, and Traditional Chinese language options.

AQUAPAZZA: Aquaplus Dream Match first launched for arcades on June 22, 2011 in Japan, followed by PlayStation 3 on August 30, 2012 in Japan and November 19, 2013 in North America.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

26 characters from across AQUAPLUS’s classic franchises clash in this action-packed fighting game! Master your favorite heroes from games and anime including Utawarerumono, ToHeart 2, White Album, and more!

Pick from a roster of over a dozen fan favorites. Dominate the battlefield with your character’s unique moveset and movement!

  • Fight hard and make aggressive plays to keep your character in peak form with the Active Emotion System!
  • Finish your opponents off with devastating and powerfully animated Splash Arts!
  • Bring new friends to the couch anytime with the optional Simple control scheme!

You don’t just pick one character to control: select one of a dozen more partner characters, then call on them for powerful assists that can change the course of the fight!

Watch the PC announcement trailer below.

Steam Trailer
